thread.title: New iPhones, iPad Pro and Apple TV
thread.title_full: New iPhones, iPad Pro and Apple TV

author: Hadlee Simons
title: New iPhones, iPad Pro and Apple TV
text:
Apple has revealed a variety of devices at its September event. 
So were the rumours true or did we see anything unexpected? 

iPhones 
Perhaps the most prominent reveal was the iPhone 6S and 6S Plus, and yes, it features Force Touch technology, dubbed 3D Touch. 
The functionality brings pressure-sensitivity to the iPhones, allowing the phones to tell the difference between a simple tap and a press. User scenarios include holding down on content to preview images - take your finger off and you're back in the app you were busy with. 
The new iPhones have a new A9 processor, with Apple claiming its 70 percent faster in CPU tasks and 90 percent faster in graphics-related tasks compared to last year's chip. 
Apple also claimed that its new Touch ID fingerprint scanner is twice as fast as last year's device. 
In the camera department, Apple has announced a camera bump from the long-standing 8MP resolution to 12-megapixels. And yes, these new phones are finally capable of shooting at 4K ultra HD. 
Love selfies? Then you'll be pleased with the new 5MP selfie shooter, complete with a Snapchat-inspired "flash". 
Hoping for Apple to do away with 16GBs as the base model? Nope, you're looking at the same pricing and storage scheme In other words, the small phone will cost $199 for 16GBs, $299 for 64GBs and $399 for 128GBs. The larger 6S Plus starts at $299 for 16GBs, $399 for 64GBs and $499 for 128GBs. 
The new iPhones will be available in the USA on September 25, but interestingly enough, Apple will also be running a subscription-based upgrade programme. This programme will see users dishing out $32 a month and getting an iPhone every year. 
Got an iPhone 6? Then there's some consolation, because iOS9 is around the corner, set for a September 16 launch. 

iPad Pro 
Apple has revealed the iPad Pro as well. 
The new iPad Pro comes with a 2072x2048 12.9-inch display as well as an A9X processor. 
Much like the similar Galaxy Note Pro and Surface range, Apple's device comes with a stylus, dubbed the Apple Pen. It even comes with a Surface-style keyboard attachment. 
Interestingly enough, Microsoft's Office representative was on-stage to demonstrate Office on the device. 
The iPad Pro will retail for $799 (32GBs), $949 (64GBs) and $1079 (128GBs). 
Apple also refreshed its iPad Mini, in the form of the iPad Mini 4, which starts at $399 and offers an upgraded processor. 

Apple TV 
The company was widely expected to reveal a new Apple TV box and this was indeed the case. 
The new Apple TV has the same fundamental design as the old one, save for the new remote, which comes with a Siri button, accelerometer, gyroscope and a touchpad for navigation. 
Siri allows you to search for content (Apple demonstrated users searching for cameos, popular comedies and more, using natural language), but also delivers previous Siri features such as sports scores and weather. 
But probably the most important feature is that the App Store is now available on the device, allowing users to game on the Apple TV. Apple confirmed that apps like Disney Infinity, Guitar Hero, AirBnB, Crossy Road (including multiplayer!) and more will be available on the platform. Read More
